scenario: Progressive's (PGR) first-quarter earnings release showed a mixed performance. The company beat consensus analyst revenue estimates with a 17% year-over-year growth in net premiums earned to $22.2 billion. However, net income was weaker than expected, rising 10% to $2.6 billion or $4.37 per share, below the estimated $4.74 per share. Analysts had modeled a top line of $21.6 billion. The company's stock remained flat in late-session trading. A conference call to discuss the results is scheduled for May 6. Progressive also launched Cargo Plus, a new endorsement for its truck coverage, indicating the company's focus on expanding coverage areas to drive growth.
